page.title: 15TRANSPORT & COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: The only modes of transport are by private car or bike. There is a bus service along the A453,in the bottom right hand corner between Ashby & Breedon. The bus services to the nearest towns are at Ticknall & Melbourne, from where the fare to Derby is about Â£1.50. Burton & Derby are about 16-24 kilometres away. Most houses in the area have a telephone, & all have electricity but no gas. Most dwellings do not have mains drainage. Electricity pylons can be seen running from N to S on the E side of the area.A water pipeline flows W to E from Staunton Harold reservoir, pumping water into Leicestershire; inspection chambers can be seen along its length. During bad winters,the roads do become difficult to travel along, but it is unusual for the area to be cut off.
